allTitles:
{"en":"About Coronavirus","es":"Sobre el Coronavirus","tom":"UN TOTOZ KATA'UANTA
TUMORO U VIRUS CORONA"}

0.tom:
UN TOTOZ KATA'UANTA
TUMORO U VIRUS CORONA

4.eng: There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus
4.tom: ESA uman un totoz kata’uan nioua tumoro kura u virus Corona

12.tom:
U virus ém pahkalaputa
karia u rura’ pahkapesika kenu

13.eng: Keep your distance.﻿2m will keep you safe from large droplets.
13.tom: Zumou’la. Ni kamu én zéi’kan pahkaayoané u rura’ mahpesiké sa zumou’la 2m.

17.eng: So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:
17.tom: Niitumo, sa ni kamu mileka si tou mahenga/mahtihoi/saki, ni kamu é léwo’zéi’:

18.eng: Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby.
18.tom:
WÉHANA MASKER SÉRA.
Ni séra én toro tumihoi/mengah witu u maskerna wo zéi’kan ikaayoma wia sé tou witu réténa.

22.eng: Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself
22.tom: Si tou itii woo zéi’kan saki. Ni sia éng kimelung uman un touna.

23.eng: People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious
23.tom: Si tou kinalaputano én zéi’kan kata’uanta, taan toro uman lumaputa u sakina.

24.eng: And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.
24.tom: Um wangun é zumou’mé im wia sé tou lakez, pahpaan zéi’kan kata’uannu séi si léwo’ pendanen.

32.eng: & even on the outside of your face mask

38.eng: However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…
38.tom: Zozo’ in téntu, satorona u rura’ ni tou saki én toro lumaput wana a…

39.tom: ni kamu péléng én toro uman masaki.

40.tom: kaapa ang gio né tou karaatému,

42.eng: And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,
42.tom: Sa kamu méikationa wana ang kinuamoma itii, an tumiona ung giomu in esa,

43.eng: and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.
43.tom:
Un totoz wangun i zuméi’ a virus é mo’as niitu karia  u sabong, um pahkulo’ ang karai,
kaapa alkohol.

44.eng: Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,
44.tom: U virus én toro uman tumahang makaz 24 jam witu un apa uman.

46.tom: an toro wangunen i zuméi’ tanu ang kenu.

47.eng: Which is why it is also good to follow these
47.tom: Niitumo, um wangun éng kiitala u

48.eng: wash with soap up to here
48.tom:
wo’asan
karia u sabong makaz wia’i.

51.eng: Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.
51.tom:
TIA' PAHTIONAN
UNG GIOMU
(kaapa ang gio ni séi uman)

52.eng: Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice
52.tom:
Tanu makazua kumantara ung kakantaren
“Happy Birthday”.

56.eng: wash the back of your hands

57.tom: Kura i mo’as u lengen makaz maweresi?

58.eng: If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.
58.tom:
Sa kinationannoma,
tia’ maarét. Rengan mo’asé lengen karia
u sabong.

59.eng: Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.

61.eng: *Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long
61.tom: Si bakteri én toro malakez witu un untep u masker sa tahlous uré pinaké.

62.eng: Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!
62.tom: Sa pahgenangela kotoro u maskermu én itia’moma. U masker én tia’ pahpakén lumangkoia witu u sana endo.

63.tom: Pahpakéala léper a séndé’en kaapa wawahu’

68.eng: Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.
68.tom: Tia’ pahwali-walian i mahkan, am pahpakén mahkan, eelepan wo anduk.

69.eng: You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried
69.tom: Amoké wa’wa’ela, ni kamu én zéi’kan mamuali tumion ung giomu karia u sikumu.

70.eng: Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.
70.tom: Satoro é makéla siku kaapa paluka i muka kaapa menet um pepenet.

72.eng: and after being out in the public

74.eng: Always wash your hands with soap…
74.tom: Sekezé u lengenmu ém pahwo’asala karia u sabong…

78.eng: Read the articles for more tips!
78.tom:
Lakez a méipantik witu tumoro
apa an toro wangunen

79.eng: "This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel" by Chia Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020)
79.tom: "This animation shows how far you sneeze can actually travel." by Chia-Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020)

80.eng: "The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe", by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign Policy, Report. (Jan 25, 2020)
80.tom: "The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe", by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign Policy Report. (Jan 25, 2020)

81.eng: "How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands", by Elizabeth Rosenthal, in the New York Times, Opinion. (Jan 28, 2020
81.tom: "How to Avoid the Coronavirus? Wash Your Hands", by Elizabeth Rosenthal, in The New York Times, Opinion.(Jan28,2020)

82.tom: An toro bacan tumoro u mahmuali:

83.eng:
Additional notes:  Hygiene precautions in comic are effective in preventing many other common infections such as flu and cold, and should be applied in every day life, even when there is no epidemic. 
References:  lnformation in comic is based on understanding of COVID19 up till 28 Feb 2020, and mainly from these three references. ﻿https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.htmlhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/ ﻿https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-10
Additonal lnformation  A PDF version of the comic is available for free download here:﻿﻿https://gumroad.com/weimankowart 
Sharing Guidelines  This comic is free for the general public to share online and through Whatsapp and Telegram, and the downloads are free for printing out as posters for personal and educational use in homes, schools, and workplaces. 
When sharing, please remember these 3 points: ﻿1) No edits to the comics is allowed in any way when sharing.﻿2) Comics cannot be used for any commercial project﻿3) lf online, credit the creator on FB by tagging @weimankowart, on IG by tagging @weimankow (IG), or providing a link to instagram com/weimankow
﻿For all other uses, please send a request in to: comicsforgood@gmail.com
83.tom:
Keterangan tambahan: Tindakan pencegahan dalam bentuk komik ini sangat efektif untuk mencegah penularan penyakit umum lainnya, seperti flu dan pilek, dan harus diterapkan dalam kehidupan sehari-hari, bahkan ketika tidak ada wabah. 
Referensi: lnformasi dalam komik ini dibuat berdasarkan pemahaman COVID-19 hingga 28 Februari 2020, dan sebagian besar diambil dari tiga referensi ini.  https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.htmlhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/  https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-10
Informasi Tambahan Komik dalam bentuk PDF dapat diunduh di sini: https://gumroad.com/weimankowart 
Pedoman Menyebarkan Komik Komik ini dapat dibagikan secara gratis melalui media daring, atau melalui Whatsapp dan Telegram, dan dapat diunduh secara gratis untuk dicetak dalam bentuk poster untuk penggunaan pribadi atau sebagai materi edukasi di rumah, sekolah, dan tempat kerja.. 
Saat membagikan komik ini, ingat 3 hal berikut: 1) Dilarang mengedit gambar komik yang akan dibagikan. 2) Komik ini tidak dapat diperjualbelikan. 3) Jika dibagikan di media sosial FB, cantumkan kredit pengarang dengan menyebut @weimankowart, di IG dengan menyebut @weimankow (IG), atau mencantumkan tautan ke instagram.com/weimankow

bookText.eng:
About Coronavirus



There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus
SPREADS
Mouth
Nose
Eyes
Get into your
Healthy Person
Sick Person
The virus spreads when ﻿these droplets
Keep your distance.﻿2m will keep you safe from large droplets.
1
2m
Achoo!
So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:
Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby.
2
Thank you﻿*sniffles*
OR,
Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself
People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious
And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.
Chopsticks
Healthy person
Train straps
Lift buttons
Tissues
Cups
Digital devices
& even on the outside of your face mask
Stair bannisters
Mouse
Pens
Door knobs
Their hands
However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…
you might all fall sick.
or your loved one's face
rub eyes
And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,
and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.
Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,
soap
precautions
Which is why it is also good to follow these
wash with soap up to here
soap
elbow
Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.
Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice
under the nails
for 20 seconds
between the fingers
wash the back of your hands
What is thoroughly?
If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.
Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.
droplets
*Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long
Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!
Use a serving spoon
Baby
Daddy
Mommy
Everyone gets their own towel
Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.
You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried
Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.
Home
and after being out in the public
Before you eat
Always wash your hands with soap…
And finally,
soap
Stay safe, everyone!
Read the articles for more tips!

"The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe", by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign Policy, Report. (Jan 25, 2020)
"How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands", by Elizabeth Rosenthal, in the New York Times, Opinion. (Jan 28, 2020

bookText.tom:
UN TOTOZ KATA'UANTA
TUMORO U VIRUS CORONA

Bahasa Tombulu

ESA uman un totoz kata’uan nioua tumoro kura u virus Corona
i mahlaputa
Sumah
Ngirung
Weren
muntepa wana am
Tou
zéi’kan saki
Tou
saki
U virus ém pahkalaputa
karia u rura’ pahkapesika kenu
Zumou’la. Ni kamu én zéi’kan pahkaayoané u rura’ mahpesiké sa zumou’la 2m.
1
½m - 2m
Haaachii!!
Niitumo, sa ni kamu mileka si tou mahenga/mahtihoi/saki, ni kamu é léwo’zéi’:
WÉHANA MASKER SÉRA.
Ni séra én toro tumihoi/mengah witu u maskerna wo zéi’kan ikaayoma wia sé tou witu réténa.
2
Tambér
wangko’
*SROOT*
KAAPA
Si tou itii woo zéi’kan saki. Ni sia éng kimelung uman un touna.
Si tou kinalaputano én zéi’kan kata’uanta, taan toro uman lumaputa u sakina.
Um wangun é zumou’mé im wia sé tou lakez, pahpaan zéi’kan kata’uannu séi si léwo’ pendanen.
Am pemamakén i mahkan
Sé tou lé’o-lé’os uman
Titionan wana ang keréta
An ipahkepel wana a lif
Tisyu
Eelepan
Leptop,
HP wo am walina
U LUARNA
u masker
Titionan an ahzan
Mous ang computer
Potlot
Titionan am pepenet
Lengen néra
Zozo’ in téntu, satorona u rura’ ni tou saki én toro lumaput wana a…
ni kamu péléng én toro uman masaki.
kaapa ang gio né tou karaatému,
mahpurisi um weren
Sa kamu méikationa wana ang kinuamoma itii, an tumiona ung giomu in esa,
Un totoz wangun i zuméi’ a virus é mo’as niitu karia  u sabong, um pahkulo’ ang karai,
kaapa alkohol.
U virus én toro uman tumahang makaz 24 jam witu un apa uman.
Sabong
an toro wangunen i zuméi’ tanu ang kenu.
Niitumo, um wangun éng kiitala u
wo’asan
karia u sabong makaz wia’i.
Sabong
Siku u lengen
TIA' PAHTIONAN
UNG GIOMU
(kaapa ang gio ni séi uman)
Tanu makazua kumantara ung kakantaren
“Happy Birthday”.
sulu
kauréna 20 detik
selat an tutundu’
Wo’asan murina u rorongkem
Kura i mo’as u lengen makaz maweresi?
Sa kinationannoma,
tia’ maarét. Rengan mo’asé lengen karia
u sabong.
Tia’ pahtionan u luarna masker
kinapesikan rura’
Si bakteri én toro malakez witu un untep u masker sa tahlous uré pinaké.
Sa pahgenangela kotoro u maskermu én itia’moma. U masker én tia’ pahpakén lumangkoia witu u sana endo.
Pahpakéala léper a séndé’en kaapa wawahu’
Koki’
Ama’
Ina’
Mahpakéla tata’saan anduk.
Tia’ pahwali-walian i mahkan, am pahpakén mahkan, eelepan wo anduk.
Amoké wa’wa’ela, ni kamu én zéi’kan mamuali tumion ung giomu karia u sikumu.
Satoro é makéla siku kaapa paluka i muka kaapa menet um pepenet.
Walé
In taré ikaayomé witi walé
Puunala ing kuman
Sekezé u lengenmu ém pahwo’asala karia u sabong…
Kamurian,
Sabong
PAHGENANGELA
UN TOU

Lakez a méipantik witu tumoro
apa an toro wangunen

"How to Avoid the Coronavirus? Wash Your Hands", by Elizabeth Rosenthal, in The New York Times, Opinion.(Jan28,2020)

summary: This book gives basic advice on dealing with the coronavirus COVID 19 / Buku ini memberikan pengarahan dasar tentang menghadapi virus COVID 19
